abstract: Game 5 put a crimp into Tony La Russa's reputation as a genius micromanager, and Texas catcher Mike Napoli has his team one win from a World Series.
snippet: Game 5 put a crimp into Tony La Russa's reputation as a genius micromanager, and Texas catcher Mike Napoli has his team one win from a World Series.
lead_paragraph: If nothing else, Game 5 of the World Series makes us want to hit the pause button on baseball history. Because even if you know only a little about the game, you know Tony La Russa is supposed to be a genius. He will tell you that himself. Baseball announcers will tell you. Over and over and over. Isn't it written in the rule book, right there with three strikes and you're out? The old skit was "Who's on first, what's on second and Tony La Russa is a genius," wasn't it?
